nodes.bodyText: Instead of flling the guide wth the same recipe maybe add a dummy plank representing all planks and have its display name as "Any Wooden Plank"
Should I also do that for logs / stripped logs then, @LinoxGH?
You should use Tag.PLANKS.isTagged()
Nonnull annotations would be nice.
This can be removed.
This is supposed to be called after output is initialized.
I think this should be put into a seperate method returning a nullable ItemStack.
Why aren't you adding all planks directly instead of this weird placeholder?
I dont know who it was but someone told me that this was better, I had it for each item at the start and changed it to this
undo or keep?
I undid cuz I also preferred the older way of doing it
Unnecessary variable declaration
There isn't really any need for these two variables, just do it inside the if-statement directly.
Just do a return; here, no need to assign a variable.
Just do a return; here, no need to assign a variable.
else return null;
Instead of ItemStack item you can use Material type to reduce the calls to get the type.
Move this to the right location.
Never call Optional#get() without doing Optional#ifPresent() first.
Just a general thought: Should we maybe send a message or play a sound effect here?

Play a sound when the output is null you mean?
What sound, though?

Just an indicator that this item couldn't be used, either some sound that conveys "failure" XD, maybe smoke particles or just the usual "not a valid recipe" message.
It's just a general idea.
Ill do the generic message
